meanings.definition: A lump of earth or clay
meanings.sent1: The farmer picked up a clod of dirt to examine its texture.
meanings.sent2: The children enjoyed making clods of mud to build a small fort.
meanings.sent3: The clod of clay looked like a tiny mountain in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The clod of earth crumbled in his hand, revealing tiny worms.
meanings.sent5: She threw the clod of soil playfully at her friend.

meanings.sent1: He felt like a clod when he couldn't solve the simple puzzle.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a clod and forget your keys again!
meanings.sent3: The clod in the story always made everyone laugh with his silly mistakes.
meanings.sent4: She thought of him as a clod, always missing the obvious.
meanings.sent5: The new student felt like a clod among the geniuses in the class.
